sentences.english: The junta has threatened to use force, and the NMSP no longer trusts the generals.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府威脅要使用武力，新孟邦黨不再信任將軍們。

sentences.english: We must work hard to raise to a new level the military and political quality of our army.
sentences.chinese: 要奮發圖強，把我軍的軍政素質提高到一個新的水平。

sentences.english: Instead, it will make it even cagier in handling the offers of aid.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它會令軍政府更加謹慎地對待援助問題。

sentences.english: The Hunan faction is an important military and political force in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 湘系勢力是晚清時期的一派重要軍政力量。

sentences.english: The people is held down by a vicious and repressive military regime.
sentences.chinese: 人民受着兇惡而專制的軍政權的壓迫。

sentences.english: The military and civil authorities are working together to put down the unrest.
sentences.chinese: 軍政和民政當局正聯手鎮壓動亂。

sentences.english: During the past month, the junta has tighten security in the town and reenforced troops.
sentences.chinese: 在過去一個月裏，軍政府已加強安全和增強軍隊。

sentences.english: The west chamber was the place where the emperor read report, signed documents and discussed military and political affairs with his officials.
sentences.chinese: 西殿是皇帝批閱公文及與官員們商議軍政大事的地方。

sentences.english: Without Suu Kyi, nobody is going to believe the junta.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有蘇姬，沒有人會相信軍政府。

sentences.english: The junta fell less than a year later.
sentences.chinese: 不到一年後，軍政府即告倒臺。

sentences.english: The junta will leave no stones unturned to win the elections.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府將不留餘地務必努力贏得選舉。

sentences.english: The military government repressed the striking workers.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府鎮壓了罷工的工人。

sentences.english: And in so doing, they have put fear into the hearts of the leaders of the Burmese junta.
sentences.chinese: 這給緬甸軍政權帶來了內心的恐懼。

sentences.english: Even NLD efforts were severely curtailed by the junta.
sentences.chinese: 即使全民盟也受到了軍政府的嚴重削弱。

sentences.english: Socio-economic damage from over 60 years of military rule is difficult to undo.
sentences.chinese: 軍政權60年來所造成的社會經濟破壞是很難彌補的。

sentences.english: Ye Myint is the regime's chief negotiator in talks with the ceasefire groups.
sentences.chinese: 葉敏是軍政府與停火談判的首席代表。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
